text.autoconfig.HorseBuff.title: Horse Buff Config
text.autoconfig.HorseBuff.option.noWande:
Yes - saddled horses wont wander.
No - saddled horses will wander
text.autoconfig.HorseBuff.option.fairBre:
Yes - game uses alternate breeding algorithm.
No - game uses vanilla breeding algorithm
text.autoconfig.HorseBuff.option.portalP:
Yes - Allows you to travel through nether and end portals while mounted on horseback.
No - vanilla behavior
text.autoconfig.HorseBuff.option.rubberB:
Yes - Increases server tolerance for Horse movement speed, fixing rubberbanding.
No - vanilla behavior
text.autoconfig.HorseBuff.option.breakSp:
Yes - Allows mining at full speed while on horseback.
No - Dramatically slows mining speed while on horseback (vanilla behavior)
text.autoconfig.HorseBuff.option.stepHei:
Yes - Increases horse stepheight from 1 block to 1.1 blocks, making travel much smoother around path blocks.
No - vanilla behavior
Yes - Prevents horses from randomly bucking while mounted, no more random stops!
No - vanilla behavior
text.autoconfig.HorseBuff.option.swim.@T:
Yes - Lets horses swim when you are riding them.
No - Horses sink when you ride them in water (vanilla behavior)
text.autoconfig.HorseBuff.option.pitchFa: When mounted, the horse gets more transparent the further you look down

The horse wont be faded above this angle
looking below it will start decreasing opacity
Below this angle the horse is as transparent as it will get

How transparent the horse can get
100 is invisible
text.autoconfig.HorseBuff.option.horseHe:
When mounted, horse heads are angled an extra N degrees down
   0 is disabled
   30 is good for visibility and style
   45 is good for breaking necks
text.autoconfig.HorseBuff.option.jeb_Hor: Like sheep, horses will become RGB when named "jeb"
